title: In court, Maduro pleads not guilty, says he's 'still president' of Venezuela
subhead: UN Secretary-General António Guterres urged respect for sovereignty at an emergency Security Council meeting as details of the US operation were still emerging.

subhead: PM Jens-Frederick Nielsen said that "everything would stop" if the US were to employ military force against another NATO country.

title: Paris court finds 10 guilty of cyber-harassing Brigitte Macron
subhead: One person was jailed and eight were given suspended prison sentences for posting 'numerous malicious comments' falsely claiming that President Emmanuel Macron's wife was born a man.

title: In photos: Snow falls on Paris
subhead: Météo-France, the country's national meteorological service, placed 26 departments – stretching from near La Rochelle to the Paris region – on orange alert until Tuesday morning due to severe winter weather.

title: Phil Gunson: If Trump does not force Venezuela to hold free elections, 'they can agree on almost everything'
subhead: The Caracas-based International Crisis Group analyst Phil Gunson underlines in an interview that Donald Trump has had 'harsh words' for opposition figure Maria Corina Machado and sees the possibility of an agreement between the US administration and the Venezuelan regime's remaining leaders.

For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
subhead: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

title: They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
subhead: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.

title: Maduro capture marks new blow to dying international order
subhead: Venezuela's allies condemned an 'illegal act of aggression' while countries aligned with the US urged restraint but sought to avoid directly criticizing Donald Trump.

title: The return of the US's predatory imperialism
'The US intervention in Venezuela violates foundational principles of contemporary international law'
'The Democratic Party is waiting for Trump's departure, praying his successors fail to revive Trumpism'
